com.tozny.e3db

Class Client

  • Object
    • com.tozny.e3db.Client

  • public class Client
extends Object
    Implements interactions with E3DB.

    This class provides all communication with E3DB. Use it to read, write, update, delete and query records. It can also be used to add and remove sharing rules (through the share and revoke methods).

    Asynchronous Result Handling

    Most methods in this class have a void return type, and instead return results via a callback argument of type ResultHandler. All E3DB network communication occurs on a background thread (created by the class). Results are delivered via the callback argument given. On Android, results are delivered on the UI thread. On all other platforms, results are delivered on the same background thread that performed the E3DB operation.

    Note that no E3DB operations have a defined timeout — your application is responsible for setting timeouts and performing appropriate action.

    ResultHandler & Result Values

    The ResultHandler callback accepts a Result value, which signals whether an error occurred or if the operation completed successfully. The Result.isError() method will return true if some error occurred. If not, Result.asValue() will give the value of the operation that occurred.

    More details are available on the documentation for Result.

    Registering a Client

    Registration requires a "token," which associates each client with your Tozny account. Before using the SDK, go to https://console.tozny.com, create an account, and go to the "Manage Clients" section. Click the "Create Token" button under the "Client Registration Tokens" heading. Use the token value created to register new clients. Note that this value is not meant to be secret and is safe to embed in your app.

    The register(String, String, String, ResultHandler) method can be used to register a client. After registration, save the resulting credentials for use later.

    Creating a Client

    Use the ClientBuilder class to create a Client instance from stored credentials. The convenience method ClientBuilder.fromConfig(Config) makes it easy to load all client information from one location. The Config class also provides methods for converting credentials to and from JSON.

    However, ALWAYS be sure to store client credentials securely. Those are the username, password, and private key used by the Client instance!

    Write, Update and Delete Records

    Records can be written with the write(String, RecordData, Map, ResultHandler) method, updated with update(UpdateMeta, RecordData, Map, ResultHandler), and deleted with delete(UUID, String, ResultHandler).

    Reading & Querying Records

    You can read a single record with the read(UUID, ResultHandler) method.

    Multiple records (matching some criteria) can be read using the query(QueryParams, ResultHandler) method. You must pass a QueryParams instance to specify the selection critera for records; use the QueryParamsBuilder object to build the query.

    Pagination

    Query result pagination depends on the QueryResponse.last() value, which returns an index indicating the last record in a given page of results. Pass the last() value obtained to the QueryParamsBuilder.setAfter(long)) method to obtain records following the last record.

    Sharing

    Sharing allows one client to give read access to a set of that client's records to another client, without compromising end-to-end encryption. To share records, a client must know the ID of the client they wish to share with. The SDK does not provide support for looking up client IDs - you will have to implement such support out of band.

    To share records, use the share(String, UUID, ResultHandler) method. To remove sharing access, use the revoke(String, UUID, ResultHandler)} method.

    Authorizers

    This client can allow another client to share records on its behalf. That is, a client that writes records (the "writer") can allow another client (the "authorizer") to share those records with any other client (the "reader"). This de-couples the production of data from sharing the data.

    To grant authorizer permission, this client should call the addAuthorizer(UUID, String, ResultHandler)) method. Permission is granted per record type; there is no facility for sharing all records written by a client. The writer must call addAuthorizer before the authorizer can share records on the writer's behalf.

    Permission to share records can be revoked by either of the removeAuthorizer methods. It is possible to remove permission for all record types written by this client.

    Use the getAuthorizers(ResultHandler) method to see all the client's authorized to share records on behalf of this client. Similarly, as an authorizer, use the getAuthorizedBy(ResultHandler) method to see all the writers that have given permission for this client to share records.

    Sharing, cont'd

    There is no difference between an authorizer sharing records on behalf of this client, or this client sharing records directly with a reader. Removing the authorizer's permission to share records does not remove any sharing relationships set up by that authorizer. The writer must remove each sharing relationship explicitly.

    To share records as an authorizer, use the shareOnBehalfOf(WriterId, String, UUID, ResultHandler) method. Calling this method will grant permission to reader specified to read the records written by the writer, of the given type.

    Local Encryption & Decryption

    The client instance has the ability to encrypt records for local storage, and to decrypt locally-stored records. Locally-encrypted records are always encrypted with a key that can be shared with other clients via E3DB's sharing mechanism.

    Local encryption (and decryption) requires two steps:

    1. Create a 'writer key' (for encryption) or obtain a 'reader key' (for decryption).
    2. Call encryptRecord(String, RecordData, Map, EAKInfo) (for a new document) or encryptExisting(LocalRecord, EAKInfo) (for an existing LocalRecord instance); for decryption, call decryptExisting(EncryptedRecord, EAKInfo).

    Obtaining A Key for Local Encryption & Decryption

    A writer key can be created by calling createWriterKey(String, ResultHandler); a 'reader key' can be obtained by calling getReaderKey(UUID, UUID, String, ResultHandler). (Note that the client calling getReaderKey will only receive a key if the writer of those records has given access to the calling client through the `share` operation.)

    The 'writer key' and 'reader key' returned from the client are both LocalEAKInfo objects (an implementation of the EAKInfo interface), which can be persisted to storage via the LocalEAKInfo.encode() method. Previously-persisted keys can be parsed using the LocalEAKInfo.decode(String) method.

    However, note that EAKInfo objects are encrypted with the client's private key, meaning they cannot be decoded by any other client.

    Storing Encrypted Records Locally

    Use the LocalEncryptedRecord.encode() method to convert an encrypted record to a string for storage. You can use the LocalEncryptedRecord.decode(String) method to convert an encoded record back to an EncryptedRecord instance.

    Document Signing & Verification

    Every E3DB client created with this SDK is capable of signing documents and verifying the signature associated with a document. By attaching signatures to documents, clients can be confident in:

    • Document integrity - the document's contents have not been altered (because the signature will not match).
    • Proof-of-authorship - The author of the document held the private signing key associated with the given public key when the document was created.

    Use the sign(Signable) method to sign a document. Note that Record, LocalEncryptedRecord, and LocalRecord all implement the Signable interface, and thus can be signed.

    To verify a signed document, use the verify(SignedDocument, String) method. Note that the LocalEncryptedRecord class implements SignedDocument and thus always has a signature attached that can be verified.

    Reading & Writing Large Files

    E3DB can encrypt files for storage. Files are treated much like records, except the data for the file is not included inline when downloading a record. Instead, a separate request for each file must be made to the readFile(UUID, File, ResultHandler) method.

    To write a file, use the writeFile(String, File, Map, ResultHandler) method. The record type and plaintext meta arguments behave the same as with normal records. The SDK will encrypt the record in the same directory that stores the plaintext file and will need at least twice as much free space as the size of the plaintext file. The temporary encrypted file will always be deleted the upload finishes (or if an error occurs).

    To read a file, use the readFile(UUID, File, ResultHandler) method (which is as yet not implemented). The SDK will download the encrypted file to the same directory as the destination given. It will decrypt in-place, and write the result to the destination file. Afterwards, the temporary encrypted file is deleted.

    A large file Record instance will always return a 0-sized empty Map from its Record.data() method; it will also always return a non-null value from the RecordMeta.file() method on the metadata object returned by its Record.meta() method.

        public static void register(String token,
                            String clientName,
                            String host,
                            okhttp3.CertificatePinner certificatePinner,
                            ResultHandler<Config> handleResult)
                     throws E3DBCryptoException
        Registers a new client. This method creates a new public/private key pair for the client to use when encrypting and decrypting records.
        Parameters:
        token - Registration token obtained from the Tozny console at https://console.tozny.com.
        clientName - Name of the client; for informational purposes only.
        host - Host to register with. Should be https://api.e3db.com.
        certificatePinner - OkHttp CertificatePinner instance to restrict which certificates and authorities are trusted.
        handleResult - Handles the result of registration. The Config value can be converted to JSON, written to a secure location, and loaded later.
        Throws:
        E3DBCryptoException

      • register

        public static void register(String token,
                            String clientName,
                            String publicKey,
                            String publicSignKey,
                            String host,
                            ResultHandler<ClientCredentials> handleResult)
                     throws E3DBCryptoException
        Registers a new client with a given public key.

        This method does not create a private/public key pair; rather, the public key should be provided by the caller.

        Parameters:
        token - Registration token obtained from the Tozny console at https://console.tozny.com.
        clientName - Name of the client; for informational purposes only.
        publicKey - A Base64URL-encoded string representing the public key associated with the client. Should be based on a Curve25519 private key. Consider using generateKey() to generate a private key.
        publicSignKey - A Base64URL-encoded string representing the public signing key associated with the client. Should be based on a Ed25519 private key. Consider using generateSigningKey() to generate a private key.
        host - Host to register with. Should be https://api.e3db.com.
        handleResult - Handles the result of registration.
        Throws:
        E3DBCryptoException

      • register

        public static void register(String token,
                            String clientName,
                            String publicKey,
                            String publicSignKey,
                            String host,
                            okhttp3.CertificatePinner certificatePinner,
                            ResultHandler<ClientCredentials> handleResult)
                     throws E3DBCryptoException
        Registers a new client with a given public key.

        This method does not create a private/public key pair; rather, the public key should be provided by the caller.

        This method does not create a certificate pin collectionl rather, the implementing application should implement a CertificatePinner instance and pass it.

        Parameters:
        token - Registration token obtained from the Tozny console at https://console.tozny.com.
        clientName - Name of the client; for informational purposes only.
        publicKey - A Base64URL-encoded string representing the public key associated with the client. Should be based on a Curve25519 private key. Consider using generateKey() to generate a private key.
        publicSignKey - A Base64URL-encoded string representing the public signing key associated with the client. Should be based on a Ed25519 private key. Consider using generateSigningKey() to generate a private key.
        host - Host to register with. Should be https://api.e3db.com.
        certificatePinner - OkHttp CertificatePinner instance to restrict which certificates and authorities are trusted.
        handleResult - Handles the result of registration.
        Throws:
        E3DBCryptoException

      • writeFile

        public void writeFile(String type,
                      java.io.File file,
                      Map<String,String> plain,
                      ResultHandler<RecordMeta> handleResult)
        Write the given file to E3DB. Intended for files from 5MB up to 5GB in size. The contents of the file are encrypted before being uploaded.
        Parameters:
        type - Type of the record. Cannot be null or blank.
        file - Path to the file to upload. Cannot be null.
        plain - Plaintext meta associated with the file. Can be null.
        handleResult - Handles the result of the write.

      • readFile

        public void readFile(UUID recordId,
                     java.io.File dest,
                     ResultHandler<RecordMeta> handleResult)
        Read the file associated with the given record from the server.
        Parameters:
        recordId - ID of the record. Cannot be null.
        dest - Destination to write the decrypted file to. Cannot be null. If the file exists, it will be truncated.
        handleResult - Handles the result of the operation. If the operation completes successfully, the destination will hold the contents of the unencrypted file.

        If an error occurs, be sure to truncate the destination file, as it may contain partially decrypted result.

                                     ResultHandler<Note> handleResult)
                              throws IllegalArgumentException,
                                     E3DBCryptoException
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException
        E3DBCryptoException

                                          byte[] privateEncryptionKey,
                                          byte[] publicSigningKey)
                                   throws E3DBCryptoException,
                                          E3DBException
        Throws:

        E3DBException

      • verifyField

        protected static String verifyField(String key,
                                    String value,
                                    byte[] publicSigningKey,
                                    UUID salt)
                             throws E3DBVerificationException,
                                    E3DBCryptoException
        Parameters:
        key - field key
        value - field value
        publicSigningKey - public signing key derived from the key used to sign this field
        salt - a salt that may be provided and must match included salt if provided
        Returns:
        the value without signing information if verified, throws an E3DBVerificationException if it fails to verify
        Throws:
        E3DBVerificationException - if signature is present and can't be verified
        E3DBCryptoException - if a hash cannot be created during verification.

      • deleteNote

        public void deleteNote(UUID noteID,
                       ResultHandler<Void> handleResult)
                throws IllegalArgumentException
        Deletes a note with the given noteID.
        Parameters:
        noteID - canonical ID of the note
        handleResult - Result of the operation. If successful, returns Void
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if noteID is null

      • write

        public void write(String type,
                  RecordData fields,
                  Map<String,String> plain,
                  ResultHandler<Record> handleResult)
        Write a new record.
        Parameters:
        type - Describes the type of the record (e.g., "contact_info", "credit_card", etc.).
        fields - Values to encrypt and store.
        plain - Additional, user-defined metadata that will NOT be encrypted. Can be null.
        handleResult - Result of the operation. If successful, returns the newly written record .

      • update

        public void update(UpdateMeta updateMeta,
                   RecordData fields,
                   Map<String,String> plain,
                   ResultHandler<Record> handleResult)
        Replace the given record with new data and plaintext metadata.

        The updateMeta argument is only used to obtain information about the record to replace. No metadata updates by the client are allowed.

        Parameters:
        updateMeta - Metadata describing the record to update. Can be obtained from an existing RecordMeta instance using LocalUpdateMeta.fromRecordMeta(RecordMeta).
        fields - Field names and values. Wrapped in a RecordData instance to prevent confusing with the plain parameter.
        plain - Any metadata associated with the record that will NOT be encrypted. If null, existing metadata will be removed.
        handleResult - If the update succeeds, returns the updated record. If the update fails due to a version conflict, the value passed to the ResultHandler.handle(Result)} method return an instance of E3DBVersionException when asError().error() is called.

      • delete

        public void delete(UUID recordId,
                   String version,
                   ResultHandler<Void> handleResult)
        Deletes a given record.
        Parameters:
        recordId - ID of the record to delete. Obtained from RecordMeta.recordId().
        version - Version associated with the record. Obtained from RecordMeta.version().
        handleResult - If the deletion succeeds, returns no useful information. If the delete fails due to a version conflict, the value passed to the ResultHandler.handle(Result)} method return an instance of E3DBVersionException when asError().error() is called.

      • read

        public void read(UUID recordId,
                 ResultHandler<Record> handleResult)
        Read a record.
        Parameters:
        recordId - ID of the record to read. Especially useful with query results that do not include the actual data.
        handleResult - If successful, return the record read.

      • query

        public void query(QueryParams params,
                  ResultHandler<QueryResponse> handleResult)
        Get a list of records matching some criteria.

        By default, results are limited to 50 records and do not include encrypted data (a separate read must be made to get the data for a record).

        Parameters:
        params - The criteria to filter records by. Use the QueryParamsBuilder class to make this object.
        handleResult - If successful, returns a page of results. The QueryResponse.last() method can be used in conjunction with the QueryParamsBuilder.setAfter(long) method to implement pagination.

      • shareOnBehalfOf

        public void shareOnBehalfOf(WriterId writer,
                            String type,
                            UUID readerId,
                            ResultHandler<Void> handleResult)
        Share records written by the given writer with the given reader.

        This method should be called by a client authorized to share on behalf of the given writer.

        Parameters:
        writer - ID of the client that produces the records.
        type - The type of records to grant access to.
        readerId - ID of client which will be allowed to read the records.
        handleResult - If successful, returns no useful information (except that the operation completed).

      • share

        public void share(String type,
                  UUID readerId,
                  ResultHandler<Void> handleResult)
        Give another client the ability to read records.

        This operation gives read access for records of type, written by this client, to the the recipient specified by readerId.

        Parameters:
        type - The type of records to grant access to.
        readerId - ID of client which will be allowed to read the records.
        handleResult - If successful, returns no useful information (except that the operation completed).

      • revoke

        public void revoke(String type,
                   UUID readerId,
                   ResultHandler<Void> handleResult)
        Remove permission for another client to read records.

        This operation removes previously granted permission for the client specified by readerId to read records, written by this client, of type type.

        Parameters:
        type - The type of records to remove access to.
        readerId - ID of client to remove access from.
        handleResult - If successful, returns no useful information (except that the operation completed).

      • revokeOnBehalfOf

        public void revokeOnBehalfOf(WriterId writerId,
                             String type,
                             UUID readerId,
                             ResultHandler<Void> handleResult)
        Remove permission for the given reader to read records written by the writer.

        This method should be called by a client authorized to share on behalf of the writer.

        Parameters:
        writerId - Writer that produces the records
        type - Record type to revoke permission for.
        readerId - Reader who's permission will be revoked.
        handleResult - If successful, returns no useful information (except that the operation completed).

      • getIncomingSharing

        public void getIncomingSharing(ResultHandler<List<IncomingSharingPolicy>> handleResult)
        Get a list of record types shared with this client.

        This operation lists all record types shared with this client, as well as the client (writer) sharing those records.

        Parameters:
        handleResult - If successful, returns a list of records types shared with this client. The resulting list may be empty but never null.

      • getOutgoingSharing

        public void getOutgoingSharing(ResultHandler<List<OutgoingSharingPolicy>> handleResult)
        Get a list of record types shared by this client.

        This operation returns a list of record types shared by this client, including the client (reader) that the records are shared with.

        Parameters:
        handleResult - If successful, returns a list of record types that this client has shared. The resulting list may be empty but will never be null.

      • createWriterKey

        public void createWriterKey(String type,
                            ResultHandler<LocalEAKInfo> handleResult)
        Creates (or retrieves) a key that can be used to locally encrypt records.
        Parameters:
        type - Type of the records to encrypt.
        handleResult - Handle the LocalEAKInfo object retrieved.

      • getReaderKey

        public void getReaderKey(UUID writerId,
                         UUID userId,
                         String type,
                         ResultHandler<LocalEAKInfo> handleResult)
        Retrieve a key for reading a shared record.
        Parameters:
        writerId - ID of the client that wrote the record.
        userId - ID of the user associated with the record (normally equal to writerId).
        type - Type of record that was shared.
        handleResult - Handle the LocalEAKInfo object retrieved.

      • decryptExisting

        public LocalRecord decryptExisting(EncryptedRecord record,
                                   EAKInfo eakInfo)
                            throws E3DBVerificationException,
                                   E3DBDecryptionException,
                                   com.fasterxml.jackson.core.JsonProcessingException
        Decrypt a locally-encrypted record.
        Parameters:
        record - The record to decrypt.
        eakInfo - The key to use for decrypting.
        Returns:
        The decrypted record.
        Throws:
        E3DBVerificationException - Thrown when verification of the signature fails.
        E3DBDecryptionException
        com.fasterxml.jackson.core.JsonProcessingException

                                            EAKInfo eakInfo)

                                            com.fasterxml.jackson.core.JsonProcessingException

        eakInfo - The key to use for encrypting.

        E3DBCryptoException

        public LocalEncryptedRecord encryptRecord(String type,
                                          RecordData data,
                                          Map<String,String> plain,
                                          EAKInfo eakInfo)
                                   throws E3DBCryptoException,
                                          com.fasterxml.jackson.core.JsonProcessingException
        Sign & encrypt a record for local storage.
        Parameters:
        type - The type of the record.
        data - Fields to encrypt.
        plain - Plaintext metadata which will be stored with the record.
        eakInfo - The key to use for encrypting.

        Throws:

      • sign

        public <T extends Signable> SignedDocument<T> sign(T document)
                                            throws com.fasterxml.jackson.core.JsonProcessingException,
                                                   E3DBCryptoException
        Derives a signature using this client's private Ed25519 key and the document given.
        Type Parameters:
        T - T.
        Parameters:
        document - The document to sign. Consider using LocalRecord, which implements the Signable interface.
        Returns:
        A SignedDocument instance, holding the document given and a signature for it.
        Throws:
        com.fasterxml.jackson.core.JsonProcessingException
        E3DBCryptoException

      • verify

        public boolean verify(SignedDocument signedDocument,
                      String publicSigningKey)
               throws com.fasterxml.jackson.core.JsonProcessingException
        Verifies that the signature attached to the document was:
        • Produced by the holder of the private key associated with the publicSigningKey given.
        • Derived from the document given.
        Parameters:
        signedDocument - Document and signature to verify.
        publicSigningKey - Public portion of the Ed25519 key used to produce the signature, as a Base64URL-encoded string.
        Returns:
        true if the signature matches; false otherwise.
        Throws:
        com.fasterxml.jackson.core.JsonProcessingException

      • addAuthorizer

        public void addAuthorizer(UUID authorizer,
                          String recordType,
                          ResultHandler<Void> handler)
        Adds an authorizer for records written by this client.

        Calling this method will grant permission for the "authorizer" client to allow other clients to read records of the given type, written by this client.

        The authorizer client itself will not be able to read records; it will only be able to grant permission for other clients to do so.

        Parameters:
        authorizer - ID of the authorizer. Canot be null.
        recordType - Record type to give authorizer ability to share. Canot be null.
        handler - Handles result of the call.

      • removeAuthorizer

        public void removeAuthorizer(UUID authorizer,
                             ResultHandler<Void> handler)
        Remove the given client's ability to share any record type written by this client.

        This method removes the permission granted by addAuthorizer(UUID, String, ResultHandler), for all record types written by this client.

        No error occurs if the client did not have permission in the first place.

        Parameters:
        authorizer - ID of the authorizer. Cannot be null.
        handler - Handles the result of the operation.

      • removeAuthorizer

        public void removeAuthorizer(UUID authorizer,
                             String recordType,
                             ResultHandler<Void> handler)
        Remove the given client's ability to share the specific type of record given.

        This method removes the permission granted by addAuthorizer(UUID, String, ResultHandler), for the specific record type identified.

        No error occurs if the client did not have permission in the first place.

        Parameters:
        authorizer - ID of the authorizer. Cannot be null.
        recordType - Type of record. Cannot be blank or null.
        handler - Handles the result of the operation.

      • getAuthorizers

        public void getAuthorizers(ResultHandler<List<AuthorizerPolicy>> handler)
        Lists all the clients (and associated record types) that this client has authorized to share on its behalf.

        This method allows the client to inspect all other clients that have permission to share records on this client's behalf.

        Parameters:
        handler - Handles result of the call.

      • getAuthorizedBy

        public void getAuthorizedBy(ResultHandler<List<AuthorizerPolicy>> handler)
        Lists all writers (and associated record types) that have authorized this client to share data on their behalf.

        This method allows the client to inspect the list of data producer's that have authorized the client to share records on their behalf.

        Parameters:
        handler - Handles result of the call.
